hedline.hl1: To Sweep Those S.U.V.'s Off the Highways

abstract.p: Michael J Mannheimer letter on SUV's says Congress should ban 'monstrosities' from road or at least ban any further production or sale (S)

block.p: A May 16 letter suggests that the only way to get the hazardous, environmentally unsound sport utility vehicles off the road is for consumers suddenly to realize that their costs outweigh their benefits. I have a better solution: Congress should ban these monstrosities from the road, or at least ban any further production and sale.

A May 16 letter suggests that the only way to get the hazardous, environmentally unsound sport utility vehicles off the road is for consumers suddenly to realize that their costs outweigh their benefits. I have a better solution: Congress should ban these monstrosities from the road, or at least ban any further production and sale.

Unfortunately, members of Congress are unlikely to anger their constituents by undertaking such a politically unpopular act. But the expectation that politicians should exercise political courage is no more naive than the suggestion that individual consumers should be motivated more by good sense and concern for their fellow humans than by the urge for conspicuous consumption.
MICHAEL J. MANNHEIMER New York, May 16, 2000
